result.execSummary:
The defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by 6/17/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No firearms.
No violent contact with T.H.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Court ordered case expunged upon successful completion of probation.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny Maynesha Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 6/17/22.
- Complete 15 hour of community service.
- No firearms.
- No violent contact with T.H.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 6/17/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

COURT ORDERED CASE EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report- 06-09-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Plaisted requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05.9.2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plaisted has received discovery and an offer and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04.05.2022, filed.  rmm

Court ordered no contact with T.Q.H (DOB 8.3.1996)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Destiny Maynesha Brown in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Destiny Maynesha Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
